name: cesaro
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, w0)
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, w0)
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wex(s0, wa(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wex(s0, w0)
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))

comment: "Cesaro", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` , all ` ch ` is ` ps ` , and ` ch ` exist, therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, EAO-2: PeM and SaM therefore SoP. (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
